title: The ability to walk is underrated as a hard-counter
body:
[](http://apollo-na-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/1416134291614/WalkingOP.png)Very bored and very caffeinated, posting this skillshot dodging I managed which I thought was hilarious. Why did I think it was hilarious? Because being out of position, I panicked and was misclicking hardcore; this was an accident.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s8flQbg9Db0&feature=youtu.be

Edit: For the entirety of two people who think this was some sort of **Dodge program**, let me teach you how the game's pathing system made Soraka turn around with an illustration;

http://i.snag.gy/VyUvc.jpg

I clicked to move (or rather, was holding the button down, which means there will not be a green move-to icon) on the fire brazier. Blue line shows what the pathing was going to be after the 0:16 second mark when it happened. It's understandable that some would miss that and think I'm a cheater, but understandable as it might be, it's annoying.

Replay programs such as BaronReplays (my poison of choice) and Lolrecorder don't record a video, they save a small replay file which can be later viewed through the client at your leisure as if you were spectating a live match. Keeping one of those on to save all your (non vs. AI) matches is not a bad idea, as there is no downside. Though here I recorded straight off my GPU using Nvidia's Shadowplay.

Everybody makes a play (whether on purpose or not) sometimes; would love to see yours too!
